Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 146 balls remaining).
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams are near the point of no return, with two points each from four games.
Jos Buttler may always regret saying England wouldn't be 'trying to defend anything' out in India.
Peeling off five wins in a row in order to reach 12 points looks a tall order for England.
Sri Lanka ended a debilitating run of three consecutive defeats with a five-wicket win over Netherlands.
Sri Lanka have won all four encounters in the competition since 1999 and five out of the last six.
Matthew Mott has not had to intervene much since taking charge of the white-ball teams in mid-2022.
Brydon Carse can prove a Liam Plunkett-esque battering ram to raise their threat in the middle overs.
Sri Lanka have shown glimpses of their abilities through Kusal Mendis and Sadeera Samarawickrama with the bat, as well as Dilshan Madushanka's wicket-taking ability with the ball.
Victory would leave at least one Englishman happy, with head coach Chris Silverwood coming up against the side he used to coach.
England's captain Jos Buttler has been let down by his best batter, having scored just 87 runs in four innings.
Kusal Mendis was the spark in Sri Lanka's opening two games, with 76 off 42 in the doomed chase against South Africa and then a 65-ball hundred against Pakistan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium has a reputation for high-scoring games.
The city's climate tends to be more temperate, which might prevent England from running completely out of puff if fielding first.
These teams have met 11 times at the ODI World Cup, with England 6-5 up on head-to-head, but Sri Lanka have won each of the last four meetings.
Overall, since being beaten by nine wickets at the 2015 World Cup, England have won eight out of 11 ODIs between the sides, with one tie.
England have played five ODIs at the Chinnaswamy Stadium but last won there on the 1993 tour of India.
Sri Lanka's one appearance at the Chinnaswamy Stadium came back in 1982.
Buttler needs 90 runs to become the fifth Englishman to 5000 in ODIs; Joe Root needs 70 for 1000 at World Cups.
Maheesh Theekshana is four wickets shy of 50.
Others: Carse has linked up with the squad after being brought in for the injured Reece Topley, but is not expected to be in contention for this game.
Chris Woakes seems likeliest to win a return as Topley's replacement with the new ball.

England would look at the balance of their XI again after defeat in Mumbai, with Moeen Ali, Liam Livingstone and Sam Curran all offering different skillsets if they return to the allrounder blueprint.
Sri Lanka have been granted permission to bring in vastly experienced former captain Angelo Mathews as a replacement for Matheesha Pathirana.
Dunith Wellalage might come back into contention having sat out the win over Netherlands.
The strip for Thursday's match is slightly off-centre, with an invitingly short boundary towards neighbouring Cubbon Park, and looks hard and dry despite a patchy covering of live grass.
